Name:
Conner
HMS Leeds
Fate:
Transferred to Britain, 23 October 1940
Placed in reserve at Grangemouth in the Firth of Forth, April 1945.
Propulsion:
White-Forster boilers
Parsons turbines
three shafts
18,500 hp (13,800 kW)
Armament:
4 × 4 in (100 mm) 21 pdr gun
1 × 6 in (152 mm) Y-gun
12 × 21 inch (533 mm) torpedo tubes
